column4: Hi everyone, I'm running firefox 3.0.10 for Ubuntu 9.04, when I try to load my webpage in firefox, I get 'failed to load xpcom component' in the error console and none of the javascript runs. WTF is up?
Just remove and reinstall firefox.. simple
I even tried marking all firefox related packages for complete removal and reinstalling
that's what I'm running, it had never given me this problem before today
now I can't get rid of it
BTW, in the mean while, while firefox acts as a bitch, use Chrome, works for me like a charm
When U said, I removed all packages related to FF, where all from did u remove...
I need firefox to run because I have to make sure my code supports it
I just used synaptic, removed firefox ubufox xulrunner etc...
No. That doesnt remove your personal ~/.firefox which by my experience is the sole reson for all the problem
Just start by renaming it to something else so that ff doesnt get your personalization stuff
As grawity and kbrosnan suggest it is perhaps ~/.mozilla
yep, that seemed to fix it, sucks that i had to lose all my bookmarks though
No U dont hv to loose bookmarks... I think U can choose and pick the folder U want from that .mozilla
I am sure some one small file would hv caused the problem

it's okay though, they were all their for speed rather than for memory, I'm sure I'll be able to find the mozilla dom reference the msdn dom reference w3schools and all the other places I had bookmarked again
